meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>cut</kanji>, and the verb form of that is <vocabulary>to cut</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: When you think <vocabulary>to cut</vocabulary> something, what do you think about cutting? One thing is cutting down a tree, which is also known as <reading>木</reading> (き). You 切る a 木.
